    • Method Detail

      • controlProjectNews

        public static void controlProjectNews(boolean investigate)
        This performs a regular request to the JPWS project web-site to obtain information about a new program version or updated news pages.
        Parameters:
        investigate - if true there will be a report for "nothing new"

      • csvUserWarning

        public static void csvUserWarning()
        Issues a warning text to the user concerning privacy issues and security risk when performing CSV plaintext conversion.

      • controlRandomMirrors

        public static void controlRandomMirrors()
        Opens all random marked mirror files (unsaved new databases). Switches display to DESKTOP modus if necessary.

      • generatePassword

        public static ButtonBarDialog generatePassword(java.awt.Dialog owner,
                                               boolean cascade)
        Assists the user to create a random generated password and displays the result in a free-floating and modal-unbound info-box. The resulting dialog is child to the main frame. Password policy used is the global "generatorPolicy", which can get modified during execution.
        Parameters:
        owner - Dialog the owner of the resulting box, or null for global level
        Returns:
        ButtonBarDialog or null if no password was generated
        Since:
        0-6-0

      • generatePassword

        public static ButtonBarDialog generatePassword(java.awt.Dialog owner,
                                               org.jpws.pwslib.data.PwsPassphrasePolicy policy,
                                               boolean cascade)
        Assists user to create a random generated password and displays the result in a free-floating and modal-unbound info-box. The resulting dialog is child to main frame.
        Parameters:
        owner - Dialog the owner of the resulting box, or null for global level
        policy - PwsPassphrasePolicy the password generation policy to be applied or null; may get edited during execution of the dialog
        cascade - boolean if true the user can cascade with generation of more passwords trough an extra button
        Returns:
        ButtonBarDialog or null if no password was generated
        Since:
        0-6-0

      • csvExportRecords

        public static boolean csvExportRecords(java.io.OutputStream output,
                                       org.jpws.pwslib.data.PwsFile recs,
                                       Exchange.FieldSet fields,
                                       Exchange.RecordSet exclude,
                                       java.nio.charset.Charset charset,
                                       int modus)
                                throws java.io.IOException
        GUI active function to perform CSV cleartext export of a set of PWS database records. This method does not export invalid records and reports to the GUI.
        Parameters:
        output - the output stream where cleartext is written to
        recs - PwsFile representing the set of records to be exported
        fields - set of record fields drawn for output
        exclude - optional set of records to be excluded from this operation
        charset - target text character set
        modus - target data format; 0 = DATABASE (RFC4180), 1 = SPREADSHEET
        Returns:
        true if and only if operation went fine ; (false e.g. if user broke the operation OR recs file had no password defined)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.IllegalStateException

      • csvImportRecords

        public static org.jpws.pwslib.data.PwsRecordList csvImportRecords(java.io.InputStream input,
                                                                  java.nio.charset.Charset charset,
                                                                  int modus,
                                                                  Util.BufferInt omitted,
                                                                  java.io.PrintWriter errLog)
                                                           throws java.io.IOException
        Imports a set of records from a CSV formatted text source and returns the result as a PwsRecordList.
        Parameters:
        input - source input stream
        charset - source text character set
        modus - source data format; 0 = DATABASE (RFC4180), 1 = SPREADSHEET
        omitted - BufferInt, integer return variable informing about omitted records due to format or validity errors (may be null)
        errLog - printing device for error logging (non-fatal errors only) (may be null)
        Returns:
        PwsRecordList
        Throws:
        java.io.StreamCorruptedException - if input text has fatal format errors
        java.io.IOException

        public static void transferZipfile(java.io.File source,
                                   java.io.File target)
                            throws java.util.zip.ZipException,
                                   java.io.IOException
        Throws:
        java.util.zip.ZipException
        java.io.IOException

      • secureWipeFile

        public static void secureWipeFile()
        Lets the user choose a file from a chooser dialog and perform a secure wipe out operation on it. The secure wipe function performs iterative writes of various data patterns to the content of the specified file. The file is deleted from its directory if possible, otherwise it contains random data.

      • createPortableInstallation

        public static void createPortableInstallation(java.awt.Component owner,
                                              java.io.File installDir,
                                              java.io.File batchDir,
                                              java.lang.String[] sources,
                                              org.jpws.pwslib.data.ContextFile sourceIni)
                                       throws java.io.IOException
        Installs a new PORTABLE installation at the given location (should be a removable data device).

        Convention on input file list is: archive files are copied as is into given installation dir; directories are copied with all their sub-content into given installation dir where the last name segment of the source directory is used as new sub-directory in the installation dir. All archive files copied are attempted to preserve their original time stamp.

        Parameters:
        owner - Component parent dialog for messages
        installDir - File installation directory (target system)
        batchDir - File if not null target directory for batch files (otherwise no batch files created)
        sources - String[] source files to be copied into installation dir can be split into source and target name by separator ';' (target is extension to installDir)
        sourceIni - ContextFile source file for JPWS INI-file (null for a default file to be written)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • normalizedFilepath

        public static java.lang.String normalizedFilepath(java.lang.String path,
                                                  java.lang.String ext)
                                           throws java.io.IOException
        Returns a local filepath nominator normalised to JPWS requirements or null if the parameter path was null. An optional default filename extention come into effect if there is no extention present in path.
        Parameters:
        path - raw filepath (may be null)
        ext - an optional default filename extention (may be null)
        Returns:
        normalised filepath
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the parameter value does not constitute a valid filepath

      • defaultBrowserInstall

        public static boolean defaultBrowserInstall()
        Searches for some fixed application paths (defined in "command" resource bundle) and offers user to select one of the available programs.
        Returns:
        boolean true if and only if program option "browserApplication" has been modified by the user during execution
        Since:
        0-6-0
